root_causes: Variable name mismatch: expected a sub-question variable A4DKx2_99 (per expected Variable ID), but script references A4DKx2.
Incorrect allowed codes: script allows codes 1-5 in validation though expected only defines code 99 (plus any special codes).
Ambiguity in special-code handling: script treats 99 both as allowed special code and as an answer code without clarifying; inclusion of 97/98 is OK but 1-5 should not be allowed.
instructions: Use the correct variable name for the single defined answer option. If the survey defines a single-coded sub-variable, validate A4DKx2_99 (not A4DKx2) unless the canonical variable name is confirmed as A4DKx2 — update the script to the canonical variable name.

Restrict allowed values to the actual answer code plus permitted special codes. Replace the any(...) list with any(A4DKx2_99,99,97,98) so only the real answer (99) and standard special codes (97,98) are accepted.
Remove codes 1,2,3,4,5 from the validation. Keep the existing pattern that flags when a non-allowed code is present (i.e., if ~miss(A4DKx2_99) and ~any(A4DKx2_99,99,97,98) flag=1).
If 99 is intended as both the real answer and a special code in your environment, document this and keep 99 in the allowed list; otherwise ensure special codes do not conflict with real answer codes.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: expected logic includes entry condition isTest() (show only in test mode) but the script does not restrict validation to test mode.
No validation of the expected precode mask/market-specific difference is implemented (PrecodeMask in expected logic is not validated).
instructions: Limit validation to test mode as specified. Add the entry condition check so validation runs only when isTest() is true — for example, add a selection or guard before running checks: 'sel if isTest().' or guard each check with 'if isTest() and ...'.
Ensure validation allows only the defined answer codes 1..5 and standard special codes (97/98/99). The script already allows 1-5 and 97/98/99; keep that but perform it only when isTest() is true.

If the PrecodeMask behavior matters for validation (the .diff(set('2','3')) exception for non-EU), add logic or comments to handle/pre-check the market-specific allowed values if required by downstream validation rules.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: expected isTest() entry condition not applied; script runs validation unconditionally.
instructions: Apply the isTest() entry condition so validation is only performed in test mode. Add 'sel if isTest().' before validation or guard the validation statements with 'if isTest() and ...'.

Keep the existing checks for allowed codes (1,2) plus special codes (97/98/99) and the uniqueness check between the two sub-variables; those are correct but must be executed only under the entry condition.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: expected logic includes isTest() (show only in test mode) but the script does not restrict validation to test mode.
instructions: Restrict validation to test mode per expected entry_conditions. Add 'sel if isTest().' before running the validation or wrap the validation in 'if isTest() and ...' guards.
Validation of allowed codes (1,2 and special codes 97/98/99) is correct; ensure it is executed only when isTest() returns true.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: expected isTest() entry condition not enforced in the script.
instructions: Enforce the isTest() entry condition so the validation runs only in test mode (e.g., add 'sel if isTest().' before validation or guard checks with 'if isTest() and ...').
Retain the current validation (accept codes 1/2 and special codes 97/98/99) but ensure it only executes under the entry condition.

root_causes: Missing entry condition: expected logic includes isTest() (show only in test mode) but script does not apply it.
instructions: Apply the isTest() entry condition so validation is performed only in test mode. Add 'sel if isTest().' before the validation block or wrap validations with 'if isTest() and ...'.
The script's validation of allowed codes (1/2 and specials) and uniqueness between sub-questions is appropriate; ensure these checks are executed only when the entry condition is satisfied.
